alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 1:24AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Campbell, Claiborne, Morgan and Scott. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 224 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Follette, Wartburg, Jacksboro, Huntsville, Helenwood, Jellico, Caryville, Royal Blue, Norma, Smokey Junction, Cove Lake State Park, Elk Valley, Ketchen, Slick Rock, Fincastle, Indian Mountain State Park, Robbins, Petros, Frozen Head State Park and White Oak. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
